name: emojis4git
description: A utility to compose GitHub commit messages with emojis. Based on Gitmoji.

gitmoji.emojiSyntax.markdownDescription: Use colon syntax (e.g. `:tada:`) or Unicode (e.g. ðŸŽ‰) in commit message.

gitmoji.autoCommit.markdownDescription: Automatically execute git commit command. [Read more here.](https://github.com/benjaminadk/emojigit#auto-commit)

gitmoji.multilineCommit.markdownDescription: Enables multiline commit messages. Requires *Bash* shell. [Read more here.](https://github.com/benjaminadk/emojigit#multiline-commit)

gitmoji.customEmoji.markdownDescription: Use your own custom emoji mapping.

gitmoji.customEmojiMap.markdownDescription:
Define your own custom emoji mapping. Must be an array of objects. Each object must contain the following properties: 
 - `emoji` - a string containing the unicode emoji itself.  (e.g. `'âœ¨'`) 
 - `colon` - a string representing the github markdown colon syntax for the emoji.  (e.g. `':sparkles:'`) 
 - `text` - a string describing the type of commit this emoji represents.  (e.g. `'Initial commit'`) 
 - Examples of emojis supported by Github can be found [here](https://gist.github.com/rxaviers/7360908)
